meanings.definition: Make changes in something established, especially by introducing new methods or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to innovate their product line by adding new features.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to innovate her cooking by experimenting with different ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The students were asked to innovate their science project, leading to some interesting results.
meanings.sent4: In order to stay ahead of the competition, the business must constantly innovate its strategies.
meanings.sent5: The artist's ability to innovate and create unique pieces sets them apart from others in the industry.

meanings.definition: Introduce something new; make changes in anything established.
meanings.sent1: The tech company plans to innovate their software to meet the latest trends.
meanings.sent2: It is important for businesses to innovate their marketing strategies to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to innovate the menu by adding a fusion dish that became a customer favorite.
meanings.sent4: The fashion designer's ability to innovate new styles keeps them at the forefront of the industry.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged her students to innovate their project presentations to showcase their creativity.
